annotation.TEXT: Now, by Eerie bouncing, you can get up here, where there's not much of interest.
Climbing up here gets you some coins, but nothing of real importance. Also, you can jump off-screen and fall into the terrain here.
Okay, there's one that will do. Also, the timer warning didn't occur here for some reason, maybe due to the timing of me kicking the special coin up.
Nope.avi?
BGM: Legend of the Mystical Ninja - Kyoto ~ Ancient Capital of Japan
An Eerie generator goes into effect here, and that could serve as an additional way to go to the left, by simply riding a leftward Eerie.
Excellent. A well-aimed ice block can take out both the Hammer Bro. and the Lava Lotus there just like that.
It's just a shuriken.
BTW, if you walk into the stairs while standing on the floor here, you'll walk through them, and you might unwittingly fall into the hole right there and die.
There's more Japanese text in the coins.
Then, activate this blue P-switch like so, and hope that your timing was good.
Well, let's see... If I carry the 1, and then hypotenuse the cosine, I believe the square root of a fish is mustard.
Nice, I was able to off-screen kill that Lava Lotus.
...Really? All that for a single coin? I wonder if that was meant to be a 1-up, but then BlizzBuff adjusted its X position after first placing it, causing its contents to change...
"Youkai"
So, that appears to be it for this not-really-a-level. I'm going to avoid taking the power ups offered here so that I don't break the real level.
Replace the commas in this message with periods or exclamation points.
So, with the secret exit gotten, I'm now travelling up the unrevealed path towards the unrevealed Yellow Switch Palace.
Yeah, knowing that I can climb on these spots now, it's much easier to get back up.
Hello, and welcome to...
Whoa, that was neat how I rapidly stomped those Ninjis like that. It seems that for a split-second after you normal stomp something, the ascending glitch might not apply.
That, combined with my lack of knowledge about the climbing spots made getting that Yoshi coin quite tricky, as you might imagine. Anyway, let's take the upper route here.
There's some hidden coin blocks to prevent you from going over the level here.
Okay, let's take a look at Yoshi's House first.
I'm thinking I had just gotten lucky there.
So, what's to the right?
But, with more Eerie bouncing, you could go over the top of this pipe and wall here...
In the original version of this level, the platform under this Yoshi coin was only 1 tile wide, not 3.
I just need a high-enough Eerie that's going to the right...
Okay, now the pipe I just came out of can be immediately reentered, and that'll take you to the second half of the level. I'm not gonna do that, though.
First, make the disco open up the silver P-switch block. In the original version of this level, that block contained another blue P-switch instead, which wasn't right.
But, what about the normal exit, the Yoshi coins, and the moon? All shall be revealed next time, on the finale of Twistical Shinobi! To be continued... Yo!
A couple of coins there are rather unsafe to go after, so I'm not gonna worry about getting every single coin here. Also, there's a puzzle here with a reset door here.
Looks like there's just those 5 hidden coin blocks there. Alright, let's see what's in this pipe right here...
And, part of the puzzle went off already, so I'll just reset it right away.
BGM: Mystical Ninja Starring Goemon - Yamato Bamboo Forest
Now, on my initial play of the level, I hadn't figured out you could climb these parts of the bamboo down here yet, so I did tricky jumps to get back up instead.
However, a few days later, he sent me an update with some bug fixes. And, I hadn't even gotten around to editing the initial recordings in WMM yet.
This can allow rapid stomps like what I just did to that trio of Ninjis back there. I'm not sure exactly what determines whether you can get away with doing that or not, though.
...So, let's just get started here!
MOON!!! But, how do you get to it? Well, that mystery will have to wait for another time. Also, here's the midpoint, along with another pipe that takes you to the next area.
So, I decided I would just not bother with those previous recordings, and just record only this version. But, I will point out the bugfixes that I noticed as I proceed.
The screen scrolls that far, and that's it. And, I'm pretty sure there's nothing but a deadly pit of death below, so I'd better try to get back in bounds now.
BGM: Legend of the Mystical Ninja - Invasion of Evil Spirits
Let's see if I can locate a shell to hit that turn block with. I believe there's one back here... Yep!
BARF! My timing was completely wrong, and the blue guy got whacked. However, the puzzle's not completely broken if that happens, because I can still do... this!
Also, you can fall down here to skip over a couple things. Not a huge shortcut, though. Now I'll go back and show what I just skipped over.
Yep, I can just grab the special coin that way! (Yes, it's obviously a key.) I'm sure that wasn't an intended solution, but it works. Okay, now I'll make my way back to the right.
Ooh, nice bamboo. Now, truth be told, this isn't my first time playing this level. Several days ago, Blizzard Buffalo sent me this level, and I played through it and recorded it.
There are switch blocks in this level, but unfortunately, Blizzard Buffalo didn't provide a convenient level with all the switches in it. (Like the GYRB Switch Palace I've made.)
I wonder who Caham is? Well, if I see him, I'll let him know.
...Blizzard Buffalo's VLDCX level! Now, the title screen is unchanged, aside from the color palette (which leaves green squares around the berries for some reason)...
I'm pretty sure this is the Boo Block's true purpose, to help you return to the right after retrieving the special coin. Also, I'll show off all of the platforms up here.
"Big" / "Dai" (It's the shape of Pokémon's Fire Blast attack.)
So, perhaps we should seek out this fortune. Now, I'm sure you're supposed to go right first, but I'm gonna save some time and go left first, with some ghostly help...
I'm gonna mess with the speed of the vanilla music here to reduce the risk of a Content-ID claim. Anyway, this is apparently BlizzBuff's first time making a level.
So, I think the pipe below that I came out of was made exit-enabled by mistake. Blizz Buff might want to change it to not be exit-enabled, so players don't miss the midpoint.
Oh, something I just realized... You could probably do a running jump from the left platform there to go over the wall to the left and get stuck. BlizzBuff should check that.
Add "from" between "stole" and "the rich".
Yep, that's a Boo Block, and there's the Big Boo who can help me too.
And, here's the real deal, Twistical Shinobi!
Ah, and there's what you're probably intended to hit that vine block back at the room's entrance with.
Opening that block there reveals a vine, which is how you're meant to go to the left. But, what would you normally smack that block with? Well, you'll find that to the right...
There's a mushroom in the corner behind the bamboo there.
And, that's pretty much all that I'd skipped.
Now, it took me a while to realize this the first time I played this level, but you can climb on these spots on the bamboo here. It wasn't super-obvious to me at first.
Shut up, clock! ...Oh, wait, you did.
Is that coin shape there also a Japanese symbol?
Interesting...
Now, I'm pretty sure the coin shape here is meant to be a Japanese symbol, but what does it mean? (I'm sure I'd learned it before, but I've forgotten what it was.)
Also, the shuriken-tossing Chuck here is quite the pain. It's very tricky to get onto his platform without getting hit. A shell attack from a distance might be your best bet.
Oh, like the Amber Coin I've got here? So, yeah, that black opening is obviously the keyhole, which means I can get the secret exit right now, which I will do.
When the P-switch wears off, the disco shell will open up the ? block there, which contains a shell for the blue duder to kick.
Okay, here's the whole puzzle, with a disco shell, a shell-less blue duder, and a floating muncher. Also, there is a different-looking coin atop that middle turn block.
There's just the third Yoshi coin, but I'll just tell you right now that I'm not gonna go for all of the Yoshi coins on this run.
Okay, good. (BTW, if I did fall and die there, I would've just used a space-time rewind.)
Yeah, it's silly, but not a game-breaking flaw by any means, as you're certainly not trapped, and there's nothing that can harm you in there.
Excellent. Oh, BTW, you cannot collect the cyan coins here. I don't know what their purpose is, to be honest.
Add a period here.
BTW, you can slide-kill Lava Lotus, but be careful of its fireballs, which are still harmful even if you're sliding.
